description:
You are given with two integers x and y (they can be equal), and  an array a of length n. A pair of indices ⟨i,j⟩ (1≤i<j≤n) beautiful if:

a[i]+a[j] is divisible by x and a[i]−a[j] is divisible by y. 

Find the number of beautiful pairs in the array a.

Input

The first line of each test case contains three integers n,x,and y — the size of the array and two integers x and y.

The second line of each test case contains n integers a1,a2,…,an  — the elements of the array.

Output

For each test case, output a single integer — the number of beautiful pairs in the array a.

```
Sample Input 1 :

9 2 3

14 6 1 15 12 15 8 2 15

Output : 7
```

```
Sample Input 2 :

9 6 2

4 9 7 1 2 2 13 3 15

Output : 5
```

Constraints :

`2≤n≤2*1e5` 

`1≤x,y≤1e9 `

`1≤ai≤1e9`
title: Count Pairs
